data.title: really friendly people
data.text: Did not have the pizza, but their breakfast was great, fun and friendly family owned, and they have the coffee shop and bar in the Riverwalk Plaza hotel and suites,  from the three sisters

data.title: Awesome pizza
data.text:
This is a little place off the beaten path, with very nice people and awesome pizza. They sell pizza by the slice or as a whole pie. 
The crust was nice and crisp without being over done. We ordered the works pizza and the toppings were just right. Crunchy veggies and just the right amount of meat & cheese.

data.title: Not only Pizza
data.text: A great little spot for the family pizza by the slice where you can get a whole pie they even have one as large as a manhole cover so far I've not had anything that wasn't extremely good sandwiches salads pastries and their pastas all excellent price is definitely reasonable located right up against the courthouse

data.title: A lot better than expected.
data.text: One rainy evening our hotel suggested Willy B's, it is a "hole in the wall" in my book, but they were super friendly and the food was wonderful.  It was so good we went again at the instances of my granddaughter the night before we left and again it was wonderful.  Right by the courthouse off of the river walk.

data.title: Rip off alert. Beware, they add unposted surcharges to the bill!
data.text: Ordered a pizza roll which is advertised to include one topping for $6.69.  I asked for bacon as my topping.  When charged, I asked why it came to $8.32, I was informed that bacon was extra. NO WHERE is this posted. The menu on wall, menu online and book menu in shop list bacon with all other toppings. Menu states that "extra" toppings for the pizza roll is $.30 each but no mention of $1.00 extra for bacon even though one topping is supposed to be included. I informed Jeff that this is false advertising and illegal - he didn't care and refused to return the overcharge. Unscrupulous business!

data.title: NYC Pizza in SA
data.text: Our last night in SA and we were craving a slice. We found Willy B's quite y accident. It is a few blocks off the Riverwalk near the Bexar courthouse. The pizza is genuine...a nice greasy slice with a crisp, yeasty crust. The sauce is a tad sweeter than we like, but lots of cheese. The only downside was that all the tables were dirty and in need of a good wiping.

data.title: Awesome crust!
data.text: We had breakfast tacos and a breakfast pizza. Both were amazing!  The staff were very friendly and the pizza they were making for lunch smelled amazing!!  They have pretty good lunch and dinner specials too!  Definitely a must try!

data.title: first rate
data.text:
Small, crowded and bustling--but worth the wait. Fantastic crust and fresh toppings, great Greek salad too. 

Just a few yards off the Riverwalk, but miles away from the tourist-trap food.

data.title: small but inviting
data.text: The smells are what pulled us in...and the food was great and reasonable.  lots of locals and tourist...family style right on the street. easy to find.

data.title: MMM MMM GOOD!!
data.text: We popped in here on a whim, happened to see their restaurant from across the Courthouse plaza while sightseeing. GLAD WE DID! The owner, Jeff, greeted us on the customer side of the counter and stood next to us, discussing each item in detail. We narrowed it down to a handful of items and were not disappointed. The Texan pizza caught our attention, with double pepperoni and jalapenos -- oh yeah -- anddd it wasss tastyyyyy!!!  :)  MMMM The stuffed garlic knots were delishhh, as were their hot wings. We rolled outta there like a stuffed crust ourselves!  LOL   :O  Very happy to have ventured over to check them out! The place is packed with Awesomeness, just like Jeff and wife Vanessa :O

data.title: Don't pass this up!
data.text: "whole in a wall" would be a great way to describe Will B's Pizza.  Please, don't pass this place up.  Its definitely small inside.  However, the food was excellent.  Huge slices of pizza, great calzones and the salad was great.  The staff was very, very friendly and helpful.  Definitely a must for a quick slice!  The only down side would be that they only had one highchair.
